thread.title: Saints vs Colts Official Injury Report
thread.title_full: Saints vs Colts Official Injury Report

author: Scott Prather
title: Saints vs Colts Official Injury Report
text:
Saints vs Colts Official Injury Report By Scott Prather October 23, 2015 4:36 PM Share on Twitter Photo by Christian Petersen/Getty Images 
New Orleans (2-4) travles to Indianapolis for a Sunday matchup with the Colts (3-3) and will be without 3 key players. 
After practicing on a limited basis Thursday, cornerbacks Keenan Lewis (hip, stomach) and Damian Swann (head) did not practice today, and are officially listed as OUT for the game against Indianapolis. 
Offensive lineman Andrus Peat (MCL) remains out after spraining his MCL in the win over the Falcons. 
A number of players are listed as probable after practicing on a limited basis today, including left tackle Terron Armstead (knee), guard Tim Lelito (knee), wide receiver Marques Colston (shoulder), punter Thomas Morstead (quad), linebacker Dannell Ellerbe (hip) and linebacker Michael Mauti (foot). All are expected to play. 
For the Colts, safety Michael Adams (hamstring) is officially out and safety Clayton Geathers (knee) is doubtful, making him unlikely to play. 
Indianapolis linebackers Nate Irving (knee) and Jerrell Freeman (groin) are both probable. 
Kickoff Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium is set for noon.
